# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's how you could implement this in Julia:
```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    result = ""
    current_line_length = 0
    for word in words
        if length(word) > text_width
            error("Word is too long to fit into the maximum allowed width")
        end
        if current_line_length + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
            current_line_length = 0
        elseif !isempty(result) && word != first(words)
            result *= " "
        end
        result *= word
        current_line_length += length(word)
    end
    return result
end
```
You can call this function like so: `wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.")`. This will print out the string "Lorem\nipsum\ndolor\nsit\namet,\nconsectetur\nadipiscing\nelit.".
